DOC.brief_summary: The objective is to compare the efficacy and safety of masitinib in combination with riluzole in the treatment of patients suffering from Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS).
DOC.brief_title: The Objective is to Compare the Efficacy and Safety of Masitinib in Combination With Riluzole in the Treatment of Patients Suffering From Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS)
DOC.detailed_description: Masitinib is novel tyrosine kinase inhibitor that targets microglia and mast cells through inhibiting a limited number of kinases. Masitinib blocks microglia proliferation and activation, and mast cell-mediated degranulation, the release of cytotoxic substances that might further damage the motor nerves.
DOC.criteria: Main inclusion criteria: 1. Familial or sporadic ALS 2. Patient diagnosed with laboratory supported, clinically probable of definite ALS 3. Patient treated with a stable dose of riluzole (100 mg/day) for at least 30 days prior to screening 1. Patient who underwent tracheostomy and/or gastrostomy
